name: Dips
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing under a set of parallel bars, with your hands gripping the bars and your body forming an L-shape.

2. Lower yourself down until your arms are bent at about a 90-degree angle, then straighten them to return to the starting position.

3. As you lower, keep your elbows close to your sides and engage your core muscles throughout the movement.

4. Use your chest, shoulders, and triceps to lift your body back up to the top of the movement.

5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Dips are an upper body exercise that works the triceps, chest, and shoulders, often performed using parallel bars or a set of rings.
